ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Playing chamber music; ensemble skills; giving and receiving feedback; working with coaches; exposure to chamber repertoire.
Increased experience working on music from the string quartet repertoire.
I learned how to critically listen to and analyze chamber performances and developed my musical and collaborative skills as a chamber musician.

Most importantly, I gained skills in rehearsing successfully with the other students in my groups. From the TAs, the professor, and the other students, I gained insights on the different rehearsal techniques and ways to improve the sound of a chamber group. Through commenting on other groups' performances, I learned how to properly critique others' playing while remaining polite.
I worked on a chamber work with my group, focusing on aspects such as intonation, blend, dynamics, and tempo. This helped me improve as a musician.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Overall a good course. Scheduling coachings and rehearsals is complicated especially with a large group. Nice to get to give and receive feedback in performance class. Great opportunity to get to perform entire chamber masterworks. It's too bad that so few people get to experience the class because it's so selective, but also if it was larger it would not be such a special experience.

This course is great! It could be improved by ensuring that all groups could have time to play all their movements in class without going over the scheduled time of the class.

Additionally, there does not currently seem to be much training for the teaching fellows for the course. On several occasions, members of the fellowship quartet spoke in unnecessarily harsh and critical ways without much positive constructive effect. This could certainly be mitigated with a more extensive required training for the coaches.
Strengths: great opportunity for students to continue developing chamber music skills through weekly coachings and biweekly performance class
The strengths of this course include lots of opportunities to perform and get feedback from peers, as well as excellent weekly instruction.

Strengths: I loved it! Rehearsing with my chamber group was my favorite part of the week and I always looked forward to class to listen to the other groups as well. The talent in the class is outstanding and the coaches and professor are both amazing. 

Weaknesses: none
Great structure of classes and enjoyed faculty coachings

While the caliber of playing is very high, the course lacks diversity of composers. It seems that the same pieces are recycled, with no effort to include contemporary works or works by women or composers of color.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! But I will say, this is far from the only opportunity to play chamber music at Yale. You can make your own groups, join clubs, and so on.  If you are a first year, don't bank on getting into this class; definitely audition, but plan to find people to play with on your own as well: there are so many people who love to make chamber music at this school!
Yes, I would recommend this class if you want to continue playing chamber music at a high level. It is a great way to make friends and meet other students who are also passionate about chamber music.
Yes! If you're dedicated to music and willing to put in time and effort you will get a lot out of it. Our coaches Emily and Sophiko were amazing and I learned a lot from them.

Definitely audition for this course if you want to play chamber music, but it is very competitive. Additionally, the course is currently designed for strings (but not bass) and pianists. If you are a wind player, good luck.
